statement:
Consider the polynomial
$$p(x)\;=\; a_nx^n + a_{n-1}x^{n-1}+\cdots+a_1x+a_0$$ where all the
coefficients $a_i$ are integers.

If $p(x)$ has a rational zero $u/v$ where $\gcd(u,\,v)=1$, then
$u\mid a_0$ and $v\mid a_n$. Thus, for finding all rational zeros of
$p(x)$, it suffices to perform a finite number of tests.\
The theorem is related to the result about monic polynomials whose
coefficients belong to a unique factorization domain. Such theorem then
states that any root in the fraction field is also in the base domain.
